travels.title: Greece/Italy '12
travels.headertext: We visited Greece and Italy in September 2012. We started on the island of Corfu, then took a ferry across the Adriatic to Italy. In Italy, we stayed in the historic city of Matera, then visited the Amalfi Coast and ended in Naples.

entry.text: Corfu is an extremely laid back island with a number of very nice beaches. It seems completely unknown to most Americans, but has a large British and German tourist following, so English is widespread making it a very easy, relaxed place to visit.

Matera has been occupied for about 9000 years. The original dwellings were the naturual limestone caves in the area. The city grew up from there. Many of the houses are still partially carved into the hillside.

The Amalfi Coast lived up to its reputation. We stayed in a small village above Positano. We also spent a day in Amalfi. One hint: if you go to the Amalfi Coast, don't bother with a car. Traveling on the only windy, narrow road is impossible. Better to take the buses.
Naples doesn't have a great reputation, but its ill-deserved. It's a wonderful city, perfectly safe and clean with a great old section with a 2000 year history. Wonderful food, too.
